description: From Latin Sāturnālia, a festival of the winter solstice.

entries.meaning: A period or occasion of general license, in which the passions or vices have riotous indulgence; a period of unrestrained revelry.
examples: Yet if he remained, it would simply mean that his own and Hagthorpe's crews would join in the saturnalia and increase the hideousness of events now inevitable.
